meanings.definition: To strike with the back of the hand.
meanings.sent1: He backslapped his friend playfully during the game.
meanings.sent2: The bully backslapped the boy in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent3: At the party, she jokingly backslapped her brother for his silly dance moves.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind backslapped the flag against the pole.
meanings.sent5: The chef backslapped the dough to shape it perfectly.

meanings.definition: To praise or congratulate someone enthusiastically.
meanings.sent1: The coach backslapped the team after their big win.
meanings.sent2: She backslapped her colleague for completing the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The audience backslapped the comedian for his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent4: The sun backslapped the earth with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The teacher backslapped the students for their hard work on the assignment.
